item.title: Bethany add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "There could not have been a lovelier sight; but there was none to see it except a little boy who was staring in at the window. He had ecstasies innumerable that other children can never know; but he was looking through the window at the one joy from which he must be for ever barred." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Tom Leveen
item.description: "You're damn skippy I am." -- Tom Leveen

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Tom Leveen
item.description: "... I completely forgot about the pizza until the cops showed up." -- Tom Leveen

item.title: Bethany add a quote by A. S. King
item.description: "Everything was windswept and octagonal and finger-combed." -- A. S. King

item.title: Bethany add a quote by E. L. Lockhart
item.description: "I am better looking, Alessandro. And I have a cooler e-mail address." -- E. L. Lockhart

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "It wasn't a place of worship, they explained, with a note of whinnying condescension, but a community devoted to the most absolute possible expression, or incarnation--or perhaps realization was an even better word--of the incomprehensibly complex but infinitely pure sylvan values of centaurhood, which Quentin's fallen human brain could never hope to grasp. There was something distinctly German about the centaurs." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Hester Browne
item.description: "The Elephant of Depression wasn't just parked on my chest, it was relaxing there with the Walrus of Gloom and the Hippo of Bleak Friday Nights in Alone. They had beers. They were settling in." -- Hester Browne

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Tom Leveen
item.description: "Whoa, hello, assertiveness! How lovely to make your acquaintance." -- Tom Leveen

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Janette Rallison
item.description: "Even the plants in Arizona wanted to hurt you." -- Janette Rallison

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Rhys Bowen
item.description: "Why is it that there is this misconception that dark equals good. That only applies to chocolate." -- Rhys Bowen

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Beatriz Williams
item.description: "I don’t know how [books] accumulate like that. They’re part rabbit, I think." -- Beatriz Williams

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Joanne Rogers
item.description: "I don't mean to sound boastful, but he was my icon before he was anyone else's. Being Mrs. Fred Rogers has been the most remarkable life I could ever have imagined." -- Joanne Rogers

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Tom Leveen
item.description: "However, since I lacked the testicular fortitude to make contact with Becky, I went ahead and called Sydney the next afternoon and met her at the mall that night." -- Tom Leveen

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Beatriz Williams
item.description:
"Your father owns a history company?" I say teasingly.
Nick laughs. "No. Everyone on Wall Street has a history degree, though you'd never know it, the way they keep making the same mistakes, crash after crash." -- Beatriz Williams

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Indigestion was designed by God to impose morality on stomachs." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Marcus Samuelsson
item.description: "Just us two men," my father said, my father who had so longed for a son that he had flown paper planes--adoption forms in triplicate--all the way to Africa to make his dream come true." -- Marcus Samuelsson

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He was indulgent to women and to the poor, oppressed by the weight of society. "The faults of women, children, and servants," he said, "and of the weak, the poor and the ignorant, are the faults of husbands, fathers and masters, and of the strong, the rich and the learned." He also said: "Teach the ignorant as much as you can. Society is to blame for not giving free education; it is responsible for the darkness it creates. The soul in darkness sins, but the real sinner is he who caused the darkness." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Luisa Weiss
item.description: "Distance means nothing when your kitchen smells like home." -- Luisa Weiss

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Robin Brande
item.description: "I've always found that if your life is hurtling out of control, it's best to bake a batch of chocolate chip cookies." -- Robin Brande

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Laini Taylor
item.description: "Things can kill you. All kinds of things, like toys, or older brothers." -- Laini Taylor

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "When you're cold, don't expect sympathy from someone who's warm." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Bethany add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I opened the school's booklet, found the recipes from the examination — oeufs mollets with sauce béarnaise, côtelettes de veau en surprise and crème renversée au caramel — and whipped them all up in a cold, clean fury. Then I ate them." -- Julia Child
